text: promise I’m not ignoring you folks here, I’ll get you an answer on this today!
Haha! No worries. Any insight is great!!
Hello :wave: looking for help. Is there a way to update Lead date, MQL date via API calls? As this is not possible to edit via the interface, thank you for suggestions!
if they are HubSpot / read only you can’t update them. You would need to create your own date fields and use them to update

you would likely need to take the dynamic page (base instance) and create pages in your data strcture and merge in data from hubdb.

or use a different search that allows you to set up meta data around what you want. then you can build this into the templates of pages and have all your data on teh page, wiht the external search reading that data.
I pulled in HubDB table + row data and mutated it to roughly match the page data schema. Took some finesse but the integration is working. Appreciate the tip!
kind of a pain in the butt, right?
what search provider are you using?
Algolia. The data structure it accepts is elastic and can conform to whatever HubSpot provides.
But of course, for consistency, gotta have the schemas match.

I did a custom search integration using <https://swiftype.com/> and I was able to use a react module and build into into HubSpot. I added an “index” module to the site, and had some other things dynamically input
example of how the meta is set up: <https://share.zight.com/P8uwyPZQ>
example search page: <https://www.vanderbloemen.com/search?q=%20&size=n_20_n>
made it super easy to set this stuff up
You may not be interested in that, more or less for future searchers (lol people using search in slack)

Hiiii, looking for help with the HS API.

The client is asking for these information (screenshot) but I don’t get how or where to find it. Any suggestions? Thanks a lot!

Hi! I'm looking for help here with webhooks.
I've configured my private app and set subscriptions for contact property changes. I'm getting the payload but it is kind of limited in terms of information. Is it possible to set what values I'll like to have in that payload?
For example, if I am subscribed to "firstname" changes, I'll want to have in the payload not only the new firstname value but also the lastname, company, number of employees in the company, etc.

Thanks in advance :smile:
Interesting stuff! I appreciate the share, good looking search.
is there something up with the association and objects apis, every time i make the same api call i get different results
you find that in your app itself
in your developer account
You mean in the *private apps*? <@U03JDEHCX17>
no, if you are using private apps you don't need these, there is a private app key
oauth like this isn't necessary
you get a client id and client secret when you need to use oauth to make the first authentication
if the app is already installed you just use the token it gives you as the bearer token and you can skip this

Ok, I’m sorry but I still don’t follow… Where do I get the client id and client secret then? <@U03JDEHCX17>
It’s the client that is asking me about it…
ok, let's back up. where is the app located? in the client's portal or in a developer portal?
<@U06DEQHLLS1> ?

I have HubSpot integration in my NextJs app with multiple form IDs also as per the pages the user is visiting the payload might also vary.

Is there any open-source project or any boiler plate code to handle that kind of situation if the form id increases or conditions shoot up.

I am finding it difficult to implement it in right way. Please help

what do you mean where the app is located? I’m sorry I’m so newbie with the HS API and the client didn’t give me much info, only asked me this, so I don’t know exactly where to start, <@U03JDEHCX17> :pray:

I found this but I believe I don’t have the right access then - <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/working-with-oauth#:~:text=After%20creating%20the%20app%2C%20you,page%20of%20your%20app%20settings>.

Here, I will display this with screenshots to help out. You are updating an object record not creating a property. I think that is where the confusion of these two states is.

Here is me updating a property I created called multi_select, with one option: <https://share.zight.com/E0uJrwXb>
Let me show you the set of data we’re working with: <https://share.zight.com/2Nu9jGWe>

okay, so i can now add queen to the king, lets attempt that with a comma, and we’ll go into the error details
<https://share.zight.com/eDuePNeP|screenshot>

error message:
```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Property values were not valid: [{\"isValid\":false,\"message\":\"king,queen was not one of the allowed options: [label: \\\"king\\\"\\nvalue: \\\"king\\\"\\ndisplay_order: 0\\nhidden: false\\nread_only: false\\n, label: \\\"queen\\\"\\nvalue: \\\"queen\\\"\\ndisplay_order: 1\\nhidden: false\\nread_only: false\\n, label: \\\"checkmate\\\"\\nvalue: \\\"checkmate\\\"\\ndisplay_order: 2\\nhidden: false\\nread_only: false\\n, label: \\\"check\\\"\\nvalue: \\\"check\\\"\\ndisplay_order: 3\\nhidden: false\\nread_only: false\\n]\",\"error\":\"INVALID_OPTION\",\"name\":\"multi_select\"}]",
    "correlationId": "954c2a3f-a7c2-4c2d-a79f-46af3bbe767b",
    "category": "VALIDATION_ERROR"
}```

we can pretty the error message up a bit to make it more readable:

```{
    "status": "error",
    "message": "Property values were not valid: [{'isValid':false,'message':'king,queen was not one of the allowed options: [label: 'king'
        value: 'king'
        display_order: 0
        hidden: false
        read_only: false
        , label: 'queen'
        value: 'queen'
        display_order: 1
        hidden: false
        read_only: false
        , label: 'checkmate'
        value: 'checkmate'
        display_order: 2
        hidden: false
        read_only: false
        , label: 'check'
        value: 'check'
        display_order: 3
        hidden: false
        read_only: false
]','error':'INVALID_OPTION','name':'multi_select'}]",
    "correlationId": "954c2a3f-a7c2-4c2d-a79f-46af3bbe767b",
    "category": "VALIDATION_ERROR"
}```
As you can see, this is looking for a property “king,queen” and because that doesn’t exist (invalid option) it returns this error

so, if we try this again and use semi colons instead as the documentation suggests, you can see this updates

<https://share.zight.com/WnuXrQ9A>

You are also always able to see how you should format data going into HubSpot, by setting in the UI, and then pulling it from the api. So I’ll manually change this to queen and check in the ui <https://share.zight.com/X6uXdgWR>

And in the example I threw in the idfference here for the value and the label of the option
<https://share.zight.com/NQuB12qY>
